Hi Zyad, Thank you for joining the Procurement AI World Tour – Dubai Edition last evening. It was a pleasure hosting you, and we truly valued the candid discussions on today’s procurement challenges. The demo of Merlin Intake also resonated well in showing how it can simplify the buying process and improve overall user happiness. As we discussed, you highlighted a strong interest in how Zycus supports procurement functions—across sourcing, contracting, supplier risk management, spend analytics, and beyond. To keep the momentum going, I’d love to set up a short discovery session tailored to your priorities. Could you kindly share a couple of time slots that work best for you in the coming days? I’ll be happy to coordinate accordingly. Also, thank you once again for sharing your video byte at the event—it means a lot to us. Wishing you all the very best for your panel discussion on the ESG topic today. Best Regards, Pushkaraj Phule (PP) AVP - Marketing +91 98700 39596 pushkaraj.phule@zycus.com 
-- Avoma Event Description End --
-- Avoma Note Start --
 Avoma - : Zycus Procurement AI – CLM and Merlin Intake <> September 30, 2025 at 10:00 AM UTC
 Avoma Meeting: https://app.avoma.com/meetings/c3f533b6-e0d8-4706-bd54-c1f6adf779f2/notes
## Participants

  * Dwtc: Zyad Khan, Yamen Hmidan, Farzan Almarzooqi, Samyukta Rajendran, Ajaz Padder, Jason Tranter

  * Zycus: Dan Quinn, Tanya Rajesh, Isha Mahale, Pushkaraj Phule

## Key Takeaways

  * Project scope prioritized shortlisting CLM functionality and evaluating Merlin intake AI for PR screening.
  * Zycus’s maturity in AI spans back to 2002 with a generative AI launch in 2018 and a dedicated AI engineering team comprising 50% of R&D; resources.
  * A Microsoft Teams–based Merlin intake demo highlighted a conversational AI interface that enforces procurement policy compliance and supports PR creation.
  * Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM) features include form-based contract authoring via templates or OCR uploads, AI-driven clause recommendations (Contract Craft Pro), instant redline risk scoring (Instareview), and automated renewal alerts.
  * Next steps involve scheduling a deeper follow-up demo after the current busy period, with Tanya available for in-person discussions around mid-October.

## Action Items

  * Jason Tranter suggested that the group should circle the wagons, conduct further research next week, and stay in touch as they have time until they can budget for the following year.
  * Dan Quinn

    * Dan Quinn to connect Jason Tranter with European Zycus colleagues for DPW follow-up
  * Jason Tranter

    * Jason Tranter to visit Zycus stand at DPW next week to explore solutions and ask questions
    * Jason Tranter to conduct research next week, gather internal IT feedback on integration, and circle back to Zycus after budgeting is complete
  * Ajaz Padder

    * Ajaz Padder to remain point of contact for follow-up between DPW event and budgeting discussions

## Market Positioning Strategy

  * Merlin AI is embedded across S2P with 40–50 AI tools combining rules-based and generative capabilities
  * Modular development (not via acquisitions) ensures a natively integrated UI and seamless data core
  * First-to-market generative AI launch in 2018 positions Zycus 6–7 years ahead of competitors
  * 96% Net Promoter Score and positive recognition from IDC, Forrester, and Gartner reinforce market leadership

## Source-to-Pay Platform & Merlin AI

  * Merlin comprises 40–50 embedded AI tools (rules-based and agentic generative AI) within S2P modules rather than as a standalone product.
  * Merlin intake provides a Teams-based conversational interface that enforces policy compliance and delegation of authority while guiding non-procurement users through purchase request screening.
  * Merlin Insights extends Teams chat queries across modules (e.g., “top x suppliers in category y” returns charts from spend analysis), eliminating navigation overhead.
  * Platform delivers native Source-to-Pay modules built in-house rather than via acquisitions to ensure seamless integration.

## User Adoption Strategies

  * Embedding organizational policies and delegation of authority in the bot ensures guided, compliant decision-making
  * Conversational Teams interface reduces training needs, allowing business users to self-serve procurement tasks
  * CLM dashboards highlighting ‘actions on me’ keep users focused on pending tasks and approvals
  * Free supplier portal enables direct supplier engagement on contracts, accelerating negotiation cycles

## Future Development Plans

  * Merlin intake will be rebranded to Merlin insights to enable Teams-based queries across all modules
  * AppExtend ecosystem expansion will allow downloading third-party and custom Zycus apps for easy platform extensions
  * Agentik AI launched in January; generative AI was introduced in 2018 with ongoing additions of new AI tools
  * UAE data center launching by Q4 this year, with a Saudi Arabia center planned

## Integration & Ecosystem

  * AppExtend marketplace offers downloadable connectors for third-party services like EcoVadis and Dun & Bradstreet without custom coding.
  * Native connectors for SAP, Oracle, and Microsoft Dynamics deliver faster, lower-risk ERP integration by reducing client effort.

## AI Capabilities & Maturity

  * Agentik AI launched January 2025; generative AI toolset dates to 2018—predating public ChatGPT by four years.
  * Originated as a spend analysis vendor in 2000, expanding into full Source-to-Pay over 20 years before launching generative AI in 2018.
  * Pre-release trials with select customers ensured maturity; CEO estimates a 6–7 year lead on competitors in procurement AI.

## Regional Strategy & Deployment

  * Global headcount of 1,300, with 50% in R&D; and half of those dedicated AI engineers primarily based in India.
  * Middle East operation led by Dan Quinn from Dubai covering GCC; UAE data center launches by Q4 2025, with Saudi Arabia site planned.
  * Local customer base includes Abdul Latif Jamil ($5 billion conglomerate), CCI Coca-Cola regional bottler, and CBRE expanding ME deployments.

## Customer & Analyst Validation

  * IDC Marketscape 2025 placed Zycus as an AI-enabled Source-to-Pay Leader; Forrester as Leader; Gartner as Visionary.
  * Voice-of-Customers survey reports 96% NPS recommendation rate, earning top quadrant status for customer experience and adoption.

## Customer Journey

  * End business users submit procurement requests (e.g., NDAs, purchase requisitions, supplier onboarding) via a conversational Teams interface with pre-populated policy-based fields guiding compliant actions
  * 40% of procurement tasks are executed through Merlin intake chat, reducing reliance on the core UI for common workflows
  * Core procurement activities (contract amendments, execution) occur in the online Zycus platform integrated with ERP and eSignature systems
  * Contract lifecycle management provides dashboards showing ‘actions on me’ for quick tracking of pending reviews and approvals
  * Suppliers access contracts via a free supplier portal; executed versions, redlines, and audit history are visible and updated automatically
  * Automated renewal alerts and milestones trigger notifications at 12, 6, and 3 months before contract expiry

## CLM Features & AI Enhancements

  * IContract authoring supports configurable template library or AI-powered OCR upload that auto-populates form fields for new agreements.
  * Contract Craft Pro analyzes configured clause rules and historical contracts to recommend missing, amendable, or inapplicable clauses.
  * Instareview evaluates red-lined contracts to assign a risk exposure score and maintains a detailed audit trail for every revision.
  * Repository auto-generates renewal milestones and alerts (e.g., 3 years, 6 months, 1 year before expiry) once a contract is executed.

## Follow-up & Demo Coordination

  * Client to gather internal IT integration feedback; Zycus to connect with European colleagues at DPW for deeper technical sessions.
  * Plan in-depth follow-up demo in mid-October when Tanya visits ME; align with Jitex week (Oct 15–17, 2025) or early mornings before peak traffic.

## Follow-up Meeting

  * Jason Tranter mentioned that the next few weeks are hectic and suggested circling back after a couple of weeks for further conversations, with Tanya being in town the week after next for a possible meeting. However, no specific date or time was set.

 
-- Avoma Note End --
